intro: Ononis secunda, commonly known as lesser burnet, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features wiry, branched stems and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and often covered in fine hairs. Ononis secunda thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
